bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jessie Daniel Ames, July 30, 1942

div1.p: Hench thanks Ames for her willingness to contribute the yellow fever charts. He assures her that he has arranged his yellow fever files so that if anything happens to him, the collection would be preserved for posterity.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jessie Daniel Ames, July 30, 1942
div1.opener:
on dish
July 30, 1942
Mrs. Jessie Daniel Ames
Commission on Interracial Cooperation
710 Standard Building
Atlanta, Georgia
My dear Mrs. Ames:
div1.p:
You are indeed very generous and co-operative to contribute
the yellow fever charts to our yellow fever museum. I can only express my
gratitude by assuring you that this is not a gift to me personally, but to
the medical profession as a whole and will be preserved for all time in a
suitable museum. I am looking forward to receiving them before I enter the
army next week. I agree with you that you should have photostats for your
records and in two or three days I will send you a complete set of photostats.

I received a very cordial note from your sister-in-lar who has
sent me a few items about Doctor Ames. However, they pertain to his experiences
in the states a few years after the Cuban affair. I will continue to correspond
with her as she seems to be most co-operative. I will be most interested to
receive the Times-Picayune photostat whenever it is available. All of my
yellow fever material I have carefully gone over the last week and filed so
carefully that were anything to happen to me, the entire collection would be
preserved and immediately ready for the study of others who have expressed
interest in this material. Thank you gratly for sending me the Laredo report.

Permit me to correspond with you from time to time as I may
find time during my army life to continue my interesting study. You have been
most generous and helpful. By separate post I am sending you a couple of
little advertisements which Wyeth sent me which I believe will interest you
and your children.
div1.closer: Yours sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:as
